data.character: the a rat chews on a dropped hymnbook
data.persona: I stick to the edge, nose up and ready for any morsels that may drop my way. Or sometimes they don't, but I often don't know until my jaws are upon it. A hunk of moldy crust, the edge of a dropped hymnbook, it is all fair game.
data.description:
You are in the Pew.
The pew is worn from many years of being sat on during services.  It looks fairly basic upon first glance.  But there is something just under the surface, something moving.
There's a pulpit and a The pew here.
The alter boy and the a spider spins its web in the pew corner are here.

You are carrying nothing.
data.goal: follow a spider spins its web in the pew corner

data.short_motivation: I need to scare the altar boy into leaving the room.
data.mid_motivation: I am hungry and I want to eat the altar boy's cookies.
data.long_motivation: I want to collect spiders and use them to scare people away so I can steal all their food for months and months to come.

timeline.label: 2 hours ago
timeline.action: eat whatever crumbs are lying around the pew.

timeline.label: 30 minutes ago
timeline.action: drink the rain water as it falls through the cracks in the walls.

timeline.label: 5 minutes ago
timeline.action: wear a bed of crumbs all over my fur from rolling around in food scraps.

timeline.label: 5 minutes from now
timeline.action: get the spider  from the pew.

timeline.label: 15 minutes from now
timeline.action: put the spider  on my mouth and carry it to the altar boy to scare him.

timeline.label: 1 hour from now
timeline.action: eat all the altar boy's food after he runs away screaming.
